text:
When a servlet is set to load on startup and is part of a DefaultContext
environment entries are not available in the servlet's init() method.

Disabling load on startup or creating a standard context removes the problem.

Test case to follow...
creator: lee@lshift.net

text:
The above test case prints all enviroment entries to std_out in the init()
method, and back to the user in doGet().

I have been usinging the following context entry in server.xml

<DefaultContext reloadable="true" debug="99">
  <Environment name="test env environment"
               value="test env value"
               type="java.lang.String"/>
</DefaultContext>

creator: lee@lshift.net
text: Forgot to mention that resources are not affected, just environment entries.
